intro: Luzula odaesanensis, commonly known as the Odaesan sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower spikes during the summer months. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
